title: What are the differences and similarities between social theory and critical theory? - Quora

response.answer_text: Simply: Social theory is any theory that attempts to describe social phenomenon. Social theories are the theories of sociology and social psychology. An example of social theory: Weber’s drawing of connections between capitalism and certain forms of Protestantism. Critical theory is the term usually applied to the collect works of the Frankfurt School, also known as the neo-Marxists. They attempted to incorporate learnings from failures of communism (Stalin, etc.) into Marxist theory, to create a new Marxist theory. Critical theory is a type of social theory, based on the work of the Frankfort School. But not all social theories are critical theory.
Am I right in thinking that critical theory openly acknowledges its links to neo Marxism, whereas social theory seeks more to distance itself from this?
